org.starhope.appius.sys.op
Class Filter

java.lang.Object
  org.starhope.appius.sql.SQLPeerDatum
      org.starhope.appius.sys.op.Filter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Object>, AbstractCensor
public class Filter
extends SQLPeerDatum
implements AbstractCensor

This class represents (and actually provides the services of) a filter capable of identifying offensive content in text, and flagging it.

The actual implementation of the filter itself can be altered as necessary to catch more malevolent attempts to bypass the filtration system, as needed.

Author:
Bruce-Robert Pocock
See Also:
Serialized Form

squish

private static String squish(String in)

This is an handy little utility which takes a string and squishes it down, removing all non-letter characters.

Exceptions: We map @ => a, and ! => i.

Example:

‘Oh,’ she said, ‘you're changing;’ but we're always changing, and it does not bother me to say, ‘This isn't love,’ because if you don't want to talk about it then it isn't love, and I guess I'm gonna have to learn to live without it; but I'm sure there's something in a shade of grey — something in-between — and I can always change my name, if that's what you mean.

Becomes (with line breaks added for clarity): 

 ohshesaidyourechangingbutwerealwayschanginganditdoesnotbothermeto
 saythisisntlovebecauseifyoudontwanttotalkaboutitthenitisntloveand
 iguessimgonnahavetolearntolivewithoutitbutimsuretheressomethingin
 ashadeofgreysomethinginbetweenandicanalwayschangemynameifthatswha
 tyoumean

(lyrics, "Anna Begins," Ten, Pearl Jam, © You Make Me Sick I Make Music, Inc.)

Parameters:
in - the string to be squished
Returns:
The squished string.

addException

public void addException(String pat,
                         String exception,
                         FilterAction action)
                  throws DataException
This adds an exception to a pattern.

Parameters:
pat - The pattern to which the exception is needed
exception - The pattern which defines an exception to the parent pattern
action - the Action to take if the exception is matched
Throws:
DataException - if the action is not supplied

addPattern

public void addPattern(String pat,
                       FilterAction action)
                throws DataException
Adds a new pattern to this filter, with the supplied action associated.

Parameters:
pat - The pattern which is to be filtered
action - The action to be taken if the pattern is encountered
Throws:
DataException - if the pattern or action are missing or invalid

addPattern

private void addPattern(String pattern,
                        String matcher,
                        String action)
Used for adding patterns from the database's stringy representations

Parameters:
pattern - The pattern or word
matcher - "R" for regular expression or "W" for word
action - "K" for kick, "W" for warn, "X" for none.

public Vector<String> getExceptions(String pat)
                             throws NotFoundException
Gets the exception patterns associated with a given "main" pattern

Parameters:
pat - the pattern to which the exceptions are wanted
Returns:
a (possibly zero-length) vector containing the pattern strings of all exceptions to the given pattern

NotFoundException - if the pattern is not found

hasPattern

public boolean hasPattern(String pat)
Determine whether the given pattern is found in the Filter.

Parameters:

Returns:
true, if the pattern is defined.

isAllowed

public boolean isAllowed(String text)
Note: the definition of "allowed" is that the string results in no action, either because it does not match any patterns, or because it matches an exception with an action type of ACT_NONE

Parameters:
text - the string to be tested (filtered)
Returns:
true, if the string is allowed (action of ACT_NONE) by this filter.

isForbidden

public boolean isForbidden(String text)
This is the inverse of isAllowed(String) (q.v.)

Parameters:
text - the text to be tested (filtered)
Returns:
true, if the string is forbidden (action other than ACT_NONE) by this filter

toJSON

public org.json.JSONObject toJSON()
This routine returns a null JSON object. Filters are not currently serialized to the client, because we don't want anyone to be able to find out what we're filtering. This might need to be revisited, though, for the purposes of moderators.

Overrides:
toJSON in class SQLPeerDatum
Returns:
This object's data, serialized into JSON form.
